intro: Verbascum shepardii, commonly known as Sheppard's mullein, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Verbascum shepardii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
